intro: Oenothera sinuata var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its showy, tubular flowers that attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
